By The Numbers   Social Media   News & Events   NYU Stern Street Team     Academics Business Degree   Business & Political Economy Degree   Faculty   Academic Advising   Research   Practitioners Seminar   Stern Bulletin     Stern Around the World International Studies Program   Business & Political Economy Degree Program   Short-Term Immersions   Semester Away     Social Impact Social Impact Curriculum   Social Impact Initiatives     Dynamic Community Building Community   Living & Learning in New York City   Leadership Initiatives   Student Clubs and Organizations     Future Success Professional Development   Internships & Careers     Admissions Financial Aid   Transfer Applicants   Apply               Home / Programs & Admissions / Undergraduate / Academics / Business & Political Economy Degree                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Business and Political Economy (BPE) Degree  Travel the globe while earning your BPE degree  Stern’s Business and Political Economy degree will provide you with a unique global perspective that focuses on the connections between business, politics and economics and includes two full semesters of global study, with an option for a third semester away.    The BPE degree merges liberal arts, social impact learning, and co-curricular experiences - while still offering you flexibility to pursue your individual interests. The two required semesters of global study, in addition to the hallmark International Studies Program (ISP) , will give you a real-world understanding of today's global business environment. The well-rounded BPE degree prepares you for the broadest array of international business careers – be it in multinational corporations, government, non-profit organizations, and more.     Throughout your four years, you will:      Take tailored BPE courses as well as business courses with students in Stern’s core program.    Study abroad for two semesters at NYU’s campus in London, and have the option of spending a third semester at NYU campuses in New York, Shanghai, Washington, D.C., or any other NYU site where you will be able to fulfill the BPE requirements.    Participate in the ISP Program.    Choose elective courses from across the University and be able to pursue a minor outside of Stern. Alexander Hamilton Center    | New York University                                     Skip to page Content.     NEW YORK UNIVERSITY     ARTS AND SCIENCE     COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE     GRADUATE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                                 Home     About       People       Events       Courses       Affiliations       Projects       FAQ       Application             The Alexander  Hamilton Center  for Political Economy at New York   University use modern  political economy approaches based in logic and evidence to find answers to  contemporary public policy problems. The  Center achieves this goal by providing an open non-partisan forum to debate  solutions for public policy problems. The activities of the Center include undergraduate eduction, faculty engagement and support for conferences and collaborative work. Undergraduate Certificate Program Graduate Certificate Program 2014 Graduate Conference on Political Economy                   Contact Us | © New York University , Arts and Science
